message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CR 

The paper deals with authorship attribution, which is a problem related to natural language processing and information retrieval. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also involves machine learning techniques such as Radial Basis Neural Networks and reinforcement learning, which are commonly used in sub-categories such as cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses the importance of authorship attribution in the context of security and copyright preservation, which suggests a possible fit with sub-category cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). Finally, the paper involves a preprocessing step for word-grouping and time-period related analysis, which could be relevant to sub-category cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
